website_summaries.verdict: An affordable way to provide warmth and comfort inside your dog's crate.
pros: Bottom rubber grip keeps mat from sliding in crate
Quality of mat is not affected by the low price point
Split corners help the mat fit in a variety of crates
Made from self-warming materials to keep your dog warm and cozy
cons: Mat is on the thin side, you may need to add an extra cushion underneath

customer_reviews.title: NOT Durable certainly NOT Chew Resistant let alone proof...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it makes a crinkly sound, which must have made my dog think it was a chew toy she had it totally destroyed it in a matter of minutes. She is a approximately 25lb blue heeler/husky mix not a large dog at all and had no problem chewing right through this without any hesitation. I was picking up small tuffs of stuffing and the metallic plastic layer from my yard like it has blown up. Probably not safe for a dog to ingest. Maybe would work for a cat or an older more very mellow dog, but not for any chewers or more active dogs at all.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My ferals love these things
customer_reviews.text: I really needed something to help my feral kitties stay warm in the winter time. I live in NJ and it can get extremely cold here. I bought 2 K&H heated kitty houses (amazing by the way but they only give off 20 watts of heat and that's not enough when the temps drop below 20 degrees with heavy wind). So, I decided buying 2 warming mats to put inside the houses should do it. Well, the kitties love it and they are hardly ever not in their houses (only when it's breakfast or dinner time). Well worth the money and investment, very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Overall A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is ideal for mildly cool temperatures, but not for winter temperatures if meant to be outside. We have been using this pad for a stray cat that has been essentially living in our backyard (we can't accept him at this time) as we wait to find him a home. It has worked well until about now when winter temperatures are about to settle in. We are ordering a heating pad that's powered to keep him warm in winter temperatures. If you are just using this product for inside and don't want to use electricity - this pad is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it actually helps with warmth (they're strictly indoor anyway), or if they just like the feel of the fabric, but my cats lay on this all the time. It brings a tear to my eye when my cats will actually use something I spent money on for them, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney S.

customer_reviews.title: My cats new best friend
customer_reviews.text: I got one big mat to go on top of my dog’s crate and two small ones to put in window seats. My cats love these so much they’ve actually taken over my dog’s house :-) And I’ve had to buy another window seat to keep the fussing to a minimum. I’ve seen comments about the crinkle noise, but it doesn’t seem to bother any of the furmonsters.
customer_reviews.author: Ricki Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these pads over the years in different sizes and highly recommend them. I used them on my furniture for my cats to lay on. The cats loved them! I bought the first couple of pads in 2011 and the most recent one in 2015 and after all those years of being washed weekly they all still look brand new. I recently sold them since my last cat passed away and the woman who bought them was shocked when I told her how old they were. You can't go wrong with these, an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: KatieZ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Our dog likes to sit outside even in cold weather, so I was looking for something that would keep him warmer. I purchased this product in combination with a raised pet bed with canopy so that he would have some protection from the elements while he was outside. He loves it! It is very soft, with a non-skid backing. I like that there is no electricity needed. It was just the right size for my purpose as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Bandit stray cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my cat that refuses to come into the house since we got a puppy. I have a large cat house that I put the mat on thinking he would use it. I have a cat door that goes into my garage. I’ve noticed every time I go into the garage though he is never on it but instead a stray Radom cat that I have no idea where it came from is sleeping on it and as soon as I walk in it runs off like a thief in the night! So my cat does not use it but the sleeping bandit cat loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Marci C.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective and a great price
customer_reviews.text: I got the smallest size at ten bucks, in gray. Right now, I use it by itself on the carpet and the cats love to stretch out on it in front of an open balcony door. It reflects their body heat back to them, and I love that there are no wires or outside power source. It's worry free that way, and washable too. There is a very slight crinkling sound but it's barely noticeable and the cats don't mind it at all. I like how I can also use it as padding for a colder winter night in their hooded bed that doesn't have much padding on the bottom. A win all around.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Lola’s Kitty Cozy
customer_reviews.text: Received the order and totally pleased with my purchase. These are designed as a crate pad, not as a bed. I put one on Lola the cat’s corner of the my bed and one in her small cave bed on top of the bed’s built in pad. Lola is an older rescue (recent) and currently is under weight so all the warmth she can get this very cold winter is appreciated. She loves her bed and stays on her comfy spot on the bed where her mat resides. I have fallen asleep with my arm on the mat and been impressed with how cozy the mat gets, not HOT but a gentle warm spot.
customer_reviews.author: Lainee

customer_reviews.title: This really does work. I had my doubts initially ...
customer_reviews.text: This really does work. I had my doubts initially, because I tried sitting on it, and I did not really feel the difference at first. I think you really have to be on it for a while before the insulating properties become obvious. I gave it to my mom for her cat, and the cat definitely notices the difference – she will not sit anywhere else now. I just think this is a tad expensive for how big it is.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Something tells me these things are comfortable!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how "warm" this is but I bought one of my personal cat and one for my mom's four cats as it's gonna be a cold one this year. My personal cat has hers on my bureau where her food dishes are and I catch her laying on it all the time, so it must be comfy! As soon as my sister put down the one for my mom's cats, my dog was right there laying on it as well! Something tells me these things are comfortable!!
customer_reviews.author: PaigeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... product in the winter time and my cat absolutely loved this pad
customer_reviews.text: My cat is roughly 10 lbs I purchased this product in the winter time and my cat absolutely loved this pad. We placed it in his kitty hammock and he was drawn to it immediately. He would roll around in it and sleep all day in it. It seems like it really does what it advertises- I purchased a few because my cat would get so comfortable he wouldn't want to leave it and ended up urinating in it a few times. You can put it in the washing machine but my fellow cat owners know how horrible kitty urine is. I would absolutely recommend this product for cat owners particularly for cold weather. No cons.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: It’s the same thickness as a blanket but a blanket costs less
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst dog crate pad o have ever bought. The hardwood floors are the same softness as this thing. I have bought the heating beds from this brand and had no issues so I was surprised at how bad this one was. There are better crate pads with more cushion to them that I have bought in the past.
customer_reviews.author: D g

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. I only purchased this after it was “recommended” by Amazon while purchasing a dog house. First, it was too big, with folding sides. Second, it is cheeply made. My German Shepard tore it apart the first day. I am disappointed with the quality. I have bought several different beds for my dog, all still using, great quality . I would recommend researching options before buying what is suggested. My mistake.
customer_reviews.author: JNP

customer_reviews.title: NOT WARMER!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice pad to put in my kitties travel crate to make it a little softer. But my kitty haS DJD and was hoping for something warm for him to lie on for his joints.I have slid my hand under him when he has been on it for an hour. It is NOT warmer than anything else he would be lying on. So if you think this will help keep your pet warm in the winter or outside it will not. Personally think promoting this as warming is VERY MISLEADING.
customer_reviews.author: BKZOE

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it, and that's what matters!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to be outside but as it gets cold she doesn't want to sit on the cold concrete or the bare metal chairs. This pad does the job. I got the X-small and it fits on a standard chair very well. She took to it instantly. It has a non-slip bottom which is what I needed. Not sure what makes it "self-warming" but it works to keep a buffer between my kitter and the cold chair. Seems durable and well made, no ripping seams, very sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: Meg R.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my bunny warm during the winter.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my bunny warm in the winter. He loves to lounge on blankets, but when the room is cold, his ears feel cold, and I can tell he's not very comfortable. This was a perfect solution, because it's both warm and safe. There are no cords for him to chew, and no way for this pad to get too hot or burn him. It's a simple and effective way to keep him warm. It reflects his own heat, and it does that very well. When he's stretched out snoozing on this pad, his underside feels extremely warm, and he's very happy and relaxed. It has also washed and dried well.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - Soft and Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft, durable warming pad. My dog really likes it. It keeps its form even when washed in the washer. The only drawback is that the pad is a little too big for her medium-sized portable crate. I can get the pad to easily fit (and fit well) by slightly folding up its sides. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love it. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this pad because it's soft and keeps them warm. I love it because it's machine washable and affordable. I bought it to replace the pads that came with our Vesper cat tree. The Vesper pads are unfortunately not machine washable and cost 2 to 3 times more than the K&H pad. The K&H pad doesn't fit perfectly within the Vesper tree compartments, so I just fold it to fit, and the kitties don't seem to mind! I thought it might take them a while to get used to the K&H pad, but they immediately gravitated toward it, curled right up, and took their kitty naps.
customer_reviews.author: Sycamore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my small crate
customer_reviews.text: I use this pad in a small crate that my Shih tzu sleeps in. It's a perfect fit, and I like the way the sides fold up. The label says "self warming." Not sure what this means or if it's true, but my often chilly puppy is very cozy on this pad all night long.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: That makes these good to use for ferals or skittish cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these to use in shelters for feral cats that were dumped here. The cats really need these this winter. This brand does not snap, crackle and pop the way some self-heating mats do. That makes these good to use for ferals or skittish cats. They washed up nicely and air dried quickly. After washing they look like new and do not fade, shrink or rumple. An excellent purchase. I will be buying ore for the ferals and also for our indoor senior cats.
customer_reviews.author: EAL

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves it! Helped with crate training.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is crazy for this thing. I put it inside her Sturdibag to get her used to it, since we'd have to use it to fly to South America, and it would be a 17+ hour flight. She is an Italian Greyhound and gets very cold and shaky during winter. It really helped. She loves her carrier now. She had no problem being in it during the entire trip, and slept like a baby (I laid it over the Studibag's normal cushy pad). I really recommend this pad. It's also easy to wash. By the way, if you need a carrier, especially for flying, I highly recommend the Sturdibag also.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Waker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This warming mat is packed very well in a large box to protect the product. Upon opening, I was surprised by the quality of the mat. It is beautiful and plush. Very soft. It fit perfect inside my dogs new doggy house. Once I put in inside the doggy house I placed my dog on top of it and pet him a couple times telling him to "lay." Once he later down he instantly loved it and goes inside his new house. He sleeps longer during the night and doesn't wake me up at 6am anymore. Great product! If this was helpful, please let me know by selecting below. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Williams

customer_reviews.title: OK as sort of a pad-topper
customer_reviews.text: While this does help pets maintain warmth while in their crate (or lounging around the house), it requires additional padding. Otherwise, it's basically a thick pillow case. It's very easy to wash and I still use it when it's chilly but it is not a standalone product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy GraceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful item for my outdoor kitties
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our outdoor (formerly feral) kitties. We converted plastic totes by cutting a 6 1/4" hole at one end and now have easy cleanup by just pulling off the top and washing, drying and airing out their "condo" when needed. They used it throughout this winter and seemed comfortable even when it was single digits and it snowed. It makes me happy to see them use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: flipgirl1947

customer_reviews.title: Our Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pad that I bought for our cats. One is on our couch, and our two male cats usually sleep there, keeping hair off of furniture. The other pad is under our dining room table and our elderly female cat loves to sleep on it there. The pads are washable, and seem to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G

customer_reviews.title: My older, rescued English bulldog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: One of my rescued English bulldogs sometimes shivers even when the heat is up high and she has plenty of blankets. I thought she might like this and she does! I bought the largest one and she hasn’t left it! It’s thick, padded, and machine washable, which are great attributes. I’m just so happy that she’s happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mwrites

customer_reviews.title: Wish I coujld give it ZERO stars
customer_reviews.text: My 2 tabbies love it because it's new, they think it's mine and it's soft like the inside of my sweatshirt that they claim is theirs. But it does NOT reflect any heat. I sat on it on a stone bench in 10 degree weather for an hour [long story] and it did nothing. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: fiat_nox

customer_reviews.title: Defective and crap in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This did NOT work for me. I bought it as an "AMAZON WAREHOUSE deal" not sure about "New" electric pet mats. The used electric pet Matt I bought from Amazon warehouse changed temp by "1" degree... If that... Could have been the best from my hand. Either defective or a crap product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sacamano

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh. . .
customer_reviews.text: This is just a pad, it doesn't seem like they are particularily attracted to it in any way. I got it on a lightening deal, so it was a decent price but I wouldn't really recomend it. I hoped it would give my thrree cats one more place to nap on cold winter days, but they have places they prefer to it and I've seldom seen them use it in the past couple of months I've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Parker

customer_reviews.title: LOVED BY DOGS and CAT!!
customer_reviews.text: The dogs and THE CAT love these beds!! A tiny kitten came to us in the fall and she loves taking a claw and grabbing a corner of the pad and rolls over with it and sleeps inside. As she is getting larger, she likes to crawl under them, because they are all placed on top of flat dog beds for added warmth when the girls are out on the porch. Funny to see a dog lie down on the bed with mat on top and the cat is sleeping underneath the mat........
customer_reviews.author: Christine E. Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: I put it on the back of the couch and she took to it immediately. It doesn't drape as much as I expected with the split corners, and gapes over the area where the pad is and the cat compressed. It doesn't bother her. I haven't washed it yet since it is not attracting excessive fur.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: thin pad, great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: love it - thin pad easton carry around - easy to wash - we put imk9 roll up bed underneath to make it the perfect dog bed for the dog crate ... my greyhound appreciates the warming - i also have smaller one for my hairless chinese crested
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: My Stray Cat Uses It
customer_reviews.text: Since my cat can't talk I can only assume that he likes it because he sleeps on it in the outdoor cat house that I built for him. It is not very thick so I put it on top of another piece of rug.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, but doesn't "wow".
customer_reviews.text: The item is just the right size for my dog's bed, so it serves that purpose well. But the sides of this pad do not stay tucked in along the sides of the dog bed very well, like I had hoped they would. I'm constantly straightening it and tucking it back in along the sides of the bed
customer_reviews.author: Archer1

customer_reviews.title: She loved it so much that I bought the larger one ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat. She just loves it. Originally purchased a small one for her through a animal food store. She loved it so much that I bought the larger one from Amazon and she now stretches out at night instead of curling up in a ball. That's comfort. I know it was suggested to put in a dog kennel but this one is on my bed where she sleeps at night. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Richard

customer_reviews.title: Soft, Warm, but not Non-Slip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad to go inside my new doghouse, and rather wish I'd gotten the XL instead of the large (which was recommended) because it has plenty of room around the edges. Other than that, no problem. My husky likes it, we like it, and other than the size, it's perfect. I m-i-g-h-t get the XL in the future, depending on how much the dog actually uses her new house. That said, this is a very nice, comfy pad--a lot better than the bare floor!!
customer_reviews.author: WynterFire11

customer_reviews.title: Going back...too thin.
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. Have always had good luck with K&H products (love the heated beds!), but this seems a little thin. No princess of mine is going to sleep on such a thin "pad". Need to beef it up!
customer_reviews.author: seacoast gal

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is the third bed we've purchased for our pup, and she loves this over the previous two we picked up at our local petsmart. Probably the warming aspect it provides. For ~$20, it's a great buy if you love your animal and get them something to lay on.
customer_reviews.author: Elwin

customer_reviews.title: The cats love these
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for the cats, and they love them! They hold in body heat so it keeps them warm in their bed. They are very soft as well. So comfy to curl up on!
customer_reviews.author: HummingbirdsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: It does alright
customer_reviews.text: I've got two chilly dogs with short, short fur who dislike even the smallest hint of cold weather. They have a nest of blankets in their den/crate, but it wasn't quite enough, so I looked for something that would reflect body heat. I found this crate mat. It is "self warming", in that it gets a little warm. It's better than just a blanket, but I can't say it gets as warm as I expected. Also, the dog chewed a corner of it in about a day, so you'll want to supervise it if you have any pets who like to gnaw.
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice warm addition to your blankets for your dog
customer_reviews.text: I 35 pound dog loves it he lays on it I put it between two little blankets and he’s on that all evening long in fact I have one in every one of his beds which totals three beds
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: So we will continue to use because the cats don't hate it, but wouldn't recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure what to think of the crate pad and not sure how one knows it is "working" or not since it is self-heated by the cats. My cats don't gravitate towards this pad more than any other blankets we have set out for them, and haven't noticed the pad feeling any warmer to the touch after the cats have used it compared to other blankets. So we will continue to use because the cats don't hate it, but wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HSommer

customer_reviews.title: Actually warms!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when viewing this item, that it would actually warm that well without any electricity. But when I placed my hand or foot on the pad I could actually feel heat begin to form. So I give this rating based on this aspect. My dog hasn't quite taken to it yet, but I think she just needs to get used to something new in her crate. She doesn't hate it, she is just unsure about it at this point. The crinkle noise when stepping on it is minimal. So I think she will appreciate it as it gets more chilly. Thinking of buying one for the outside cat shelter I made for the neighborhood strays as well.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my rescue dog, a boxer mix with a thin coat. It's nice and soft and hopefully helps keep her warm. Only had it a short while so can't comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for my outside cat to be able to stay warm during the winter months. The cat seems very comfortable in his makeshift shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: The cats fight over it...
customer_reviews.text: By all appearances, this isn't anything special, but the cats think differently. I keep it in the corner of the closet (their fave place to hang out) and they FIGHT over who gets to sleep on it. Not sure if it's the novelty of it or if it really has some special cat-warming quality, but I'll probably be buying a larger one that they can share.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for older pets in a chilly old house
customer_reviews.text: My ancient kitty (and my not-so-ancient kitties) love these. They will lay on them for hours, especially during the cold winter days and nights when my 100-year-old house is cold enough to hang meat in, even though I try to keep it warm. These would be wonderful for outdoor cats or use in shelter boxes, since they work and no electricity is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette B.

customer_reviews.title: A Pinch Big
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in the bottom of my AKC travel crate for our puppy. It is just a tad too big (not much) but I kept it in there because it's necessary to have that comfort in the crate. Yes I measured the inside of the crate!!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy BB

customer_reviews.title: Makes Me Feel Better
customer_reviews.text: My dog and two cats are having to stay outside while we visit where they are not welcome inside. They are NOT outside animals and it was breaking my heart to do this to them, especially since it's cold where we are at night. This little pad does the trick. Their body heat heats it up and gives heat back to them, so much so that the air inside the large dog house feels warm. It stays in place nicely, but is flexible as well, so the dog is able to scrunch it up if he wants. He seems to take great pleasure from digging to make his bed just the way he wants. If you need it, get it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hallett

customer_reviews.title: Self warming pet pad
customer_reviews.text: I love having this pad for the bottom of my Yorkie's bed for addtl padding and warmth during her daytime napping and lounging since she has such a small body with little muscle mass. As described, well pkgd, quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: Very soft really nice got it to put in the box to put in breeze way for my cat when you lay on it ...it warms up with your body heat
customer_reviews.author: Monica Kopp

customer_reviews.title: My Cats love these!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my cats. I lay them on our beds and the cats sleep on them for hours. I wasn't sure if they would like them or not. My cats can be a little picky at times, but these have been amazing so far. I haven't tried washing them yet, so well see how they hold up after a few washes.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use in a house for my outdoor ferrel cats. They, 2 that share the the house, lay on it and seem comfortable. I bought three and rotate out so I can keep a clean one all the time. I hand wash in no scent, clear detergent by hand and hang try. I dont use softener and still feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: This self-warming mat does the job. The purpose is to absorb your animals body heat and hold it in. I purchased for my puppy when she was 8 weeks old. She is now 5 months old and waayyy to big for it. So this warming mat has been passed to the 11 year old kitty. She is highly enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: rokonrae

customer_reviews.title: kitten was warm!
customer_reviews.text: this is a good crate product for little critters during transport or in in chilly weather. it truly seems to be comfortable to this rescue kitten. he seems much happier on this than other options such as towels and pet beds.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have indoor and outdoor cats. I was most concerned about the outdoor cats due to the weather dropping into the 30's. I placed cozy blankets in a box and covered with the pad. I now rest easy. They absolutely love this pad. When I pet them they are warm, appear very comfortable and purr like cats should. Greatest product ever. They are thin but don't let this fool you. They work! I highly recommend. I purchased 5 small and then purchased 5 more of a larger size and plan to purchase 5 more. My indoor cats love them too! Don't hesitate. Buy today. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kittens
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is disabled, and her bones often ache. This seems to be helping her :) I put it under a warm lamp, and then I set her on it. She sleeps there all day! It’s her favorite
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for pets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this warming pad to use for my feral cats in the winter in houses that I made. Very soft and helpful for these cats.
customer_reviews.author: L. Watson-czapla

customer_reviews.title: Your pets will thank you
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these! We don't use them for crates but we put one in an old cat bed and one on a pillow for when our apartment gets chilly, and the cats don't leave them. They are fairly plush on their own though. I laid my hand on it and after about a minute I could feel it radiating heat back at me.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 outdoor cats. They stay outside all year since they are feral. I bought an igloo doghouse that I put hay in. Decided to get these mats for the small house and large house. Cats seem to really love these mats. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for kitty who wants to be outside when I thinks it's too cold for her. It is used to line her cozy outside bed and seems to keep her comfortable. It is not noisy or crackly. Another good K&H product.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie T.

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for an extra bit of comfort when heat ...
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative for an extra bit of comfort when heat source is not available for a porch (indoor porch) kitty .. the crinkle (sound/material) within the pad seems not too great for (some) kitties, but once past the initial introduction to it, seems acceptable to the cat. In extremes though, this is not enough ~ but the care is minimal and good for early fall or chilly weather, definitely not for really cold weather. If indoors though, its a bit of extra comfort.
customer_reviews.author: paula k

customer_reviews.title: Garage Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I have a kitty who lives in our garage. My husband was not comfortable leaving an electric pet bed warmer on 24/7 out there. Especially since the kitty sleeps in a bed on top of a car with a cover on it. So I found this. it is really a crate pad, but it fit in her bed fine. She laid on it, so I guess it was fine. Kinda hard to ask her, so I just have to go by if she used it. It did feel warm if I put my hand on it after she got out of the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Tabteacher

customer_reviews.title: Great pads - for animals and humans too.
customer_reviews.text: These are great pads. I bought them for use in our car to sit on and keep us warm in the winter and they work great. I also bought one for my husband to use while hunting to keep him warm. They are lightweight, and roll up nicely so don't take up much room. The backing keeps the pad in place and dampness can not get through. These are machine washable and hang-dry quickly - no need to even use the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: MaryM

customer_reviews.title: First I bought one pad to see if my cats will even like it, and it was such a hit that ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. First I bought one pad to see if my cats will even like it, and it was such a hit that I got another one. It must be nice and warm, because that's all they sleep on now. It does not make a loud, crinkly noise like other self-warming pads I looked at. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Regina FalangeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I can't do the crackle noise.
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back because it was too small for the crate. Minus one star not for that reason but it has a crackling sound that sounds like he walking on plastic everytime he moved. Nice and pretty but, I couldn't use it mainly because of the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: loriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for a shelter house for my stray cat. But the minute I put it on my bed, my cat went on it. He seems to love it. As you can see in the picture, it’s too small for him (size XS) so I ordered a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: lynne panciello

customer_reviews.title: Lol
customer_reviews.text: My dog HATED this thing. After sleeping on it for a week she ate it. She doesn't behave that way, has never torn anything up. She clearly did NOT enjoy sleeping on this. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Axesever

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these over time & my cats love them. Obviously would buy again. Haven’t washed these, just vacuumed them.
customer_reviews.author: stereo guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for outside kitty
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a feral cat my Dad takes care of. She sits on the pad inside her shelter and it seems to get really warm. It hasn’t been washed as we just got it recently.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: I was a little sceptical when I ordered this. ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sceptical when I ordered this. I wasn't sure that it was really going to be self warming. Boy was I wrong!! It doesn't get hot but it most certainly gets warm and if your pup gets too warm he/she can move over a little and find the cooler spot every single time. I will be purchasing a couple more of these for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Tested this by using it myself as a lap blanket for my recliner before I gave it to dog to use. Great. Almost hot sometimes. Washed on cold short cycle gentle setting. Have washed often. Air dried. It drys quickly. My dog loves this mat - a outdoor hound lab mix.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. KnitEng

customer_reviews.title: I love these. My two outside dogs use these and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. My two outside dogs use these and I decided to get another for my cats for the winter. They really do reflect the body heat back to the pet. Not bulky and easy to wash and dry.
customer_reviews.author: ACK80

customer_reviews.title: Dog approved
customer_reviews.text: I put it on the floor then let our outside dog in. He went right to it and laid down. If you move it he will go where it is.
customer_reviews.author: PkC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these thinking it would help indoor and outdoor cats. They wouldn't go near them much less lie down on them.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader in New Mexico

customer_reviews.title: Great for houses for stray cats
customer_reviews.text: We have outside kitties that we made houses for to help keep them warm during the cold months. These allow them to be a little warmer while in their little houses. We did put fabric or blankets over top to help keep them from getting dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrena E.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This crate pad came right away and was well packaged. It's for an outside cat but I haven't seen him use it yet. It seems good quality as stated
customer_reviews.author: Caron H.

customer_reviews.title: Good dog kennel mat
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It's not thick but it's not too thin, has slight padding and is really soft. Holds up great in the wash a
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today....I purchased a thermal pad in the past by a different manufacturer and of a smaller size...but I can tell already I like this one better....it has a rubberized non skid back and I love the extra size....all four corners are split....I suppose to allow it to fit better in different applications...?......I put them in my outside feral cats igloos....the igloos are of different sizes but the pad worked well....too soon to know if it will keep the cats warmer...I suspect it will by comparison in quality to the one I purchased years ago.....
customer_reviews.author: SC64

customer_reviews.title: Great warming pad for the price very nice
customer_reviews.text: The pad keep my dog warm at night he loves his Pad perfect pad for dogs who like to be warm when was the perfect size and the perfect softness
customer_reviews.author: Melody H.

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog Lilo loves this warming mat. It has been a bit cold here in Hawai’i lately and it has been keeping her warm. It is very durable and I have washed it every week since getting it a few months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat but dog won’t use it
customer_reviews.text: Nice mat. Works and lots of size options. Washes well. Only complaint is that it’s got a bit of a crinkly noise - hence, my dog won’t use it unless I make her lie on it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Draper

customer_reviews.title: No slippage problems
customer_reviews.text: Warm bottom for the kennel. No problems slipping and I love that it folds at the sides to it molds to fit the kennel. Seems to be enough padding for our Boston Terrier.
customer_reviews.author: katlee421

customer_reviews.title: Huskies love this!
customer_reviews.text: They prefer these over towels. Washable and radiates heat back to the mammal. Keeps shape after a tumble in the dryer. Good value and we bought a few for both cold and warm environments. Slip proof so it can be used on wood, carpet or tile surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: India Marie Clamp

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for puppies 😊
customer_reviews.text: Although my dog turned it upside down, but she and her puppies love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nelly T.

customer_reviews.title: Great self warming cat mats
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these self warming cat mats. And I like the attractive neutral colors
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: Our outdoor cat loves it. I was sceptical at first, but it really works.
customer_reviews.author: chris1dd

customer_reviews.title: Holds no heat
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning this item. It absolutely holds no heat.
customer_reviews.author: Cherbe

customer_reviews.title: SAFE AND VERSATILE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pad to place in my garage for my outdoor cats. They love it! There are different sizes for all types of crates, but I just leave mine on top of a cardboard box I stuffed with an old down coat so my felines can crawl in at night and stay warm. During the daytime, however, they like to look out the windows and sit on this pad to stay warm. One of the best features is that this pad is 100% machine washable! Great product, and I highly recommend it to anyone who has dogs or cats.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 5 weeks. My dog is only 3.5 lbs so not due to weight issues. Was wondering why she would be cold sometimes. It would work then stop and nowadays it’s not working at all. Tried different outlets to no avail. Very uhhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: If you have a puppy or small dog you must have this
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel of this soft mat. My puppy actually has it on another thick pad under my desk where she is right now. It is nice and warm but not like a heating pad since it is using her body temperature to regulate.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for medium-sized carriers
customer_reviews.text: Fits the crate perfectly, and the cats took to it quickly when I left it out for them to explore. There's a little bit of rubber matting on one side to grab the bottom of the carrier; I haven't had the cats test this component yet. Otherwise, no odors, no unexpected creases, no problems :)
customer_reviews.author: teufels

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works great, but it's nothing more then a small piece of reflective blanket covered with cheap material. I would suggest anyone looking to buy, simply go buy a reflective blanket (available any where you can buy camping equipment, sporting goods or even some auto parts stores) cut it to size and place it a thin soft blanket over it for your pet. You'll save yourself about $13 and should be able to make a few of these types of blankets.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Dog chewed through it the first night. Much smaller than expected and slides all over the kennel.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Dowell

customer_reviews.title: These are so nice helps keep the outdoor cats warm
customer_reviews.text: These are so nice helps keep the outdoor cats warm, and there are a lot of them. They wash very well also.I will be buying more soon. My cat thank you
customer_reviews.author: janice hall

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Large size was for outside cat but inside cat claimed it
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Bonanni

customer_reviews.title: I was so happy. I put it in the bottom of his ...
customer_reviews.text: My cold nature dog loves this mat. I was so happy. I put it in the bottom of his crate. In the past, when we have had to crate him during the day he would destroy what we put in there for him to lay on. This he has not and if he gets cold I've noticed he will leave his other mats around the house and go lay in his crate. If I take this mat out of the crate and put it on top of one of the other fluffy mats in the house he goes straight over and lays down. So a definite winner at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Rodes

customer_reviews.title: Dogs hate it
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, hardly usable. I put it in the crate and had to put a folded blanket under it due to it being so thin. Dogs (2 of them did the same thing) moved it aside so they could lay on the blanket. Might be able to use it for cat crate when they need to go to the vet so won't return it since it was so cheap anyway. Would NOT recommend if your dogs like comfort.
customer_reviews.author: lizzieinmd

product_meta.title: K&H Pet Products Self-Warming Pet Crate Pad
product_meta.description: Color:Gray| Size:X-Small 14 X 22 Inches| Style:Retail PackageK&H Self-Warming Crate Pads are available in multiple sizes and colors. The self-warming pad will capture the pet's body heat and radiate back the warmth to the source. The 4 corners are slit to allow the pad to fit many different edges. The adjustable size makes this pad fit into many different crates. The topside of the crate pad is made from soft, inviting microfleece while the bottom has a "stay pet" non-slip fabric to keep the pad from bunching up in the crate. Simply throw the whole pad in the wash for easy cleaning and care.
feature_bullets: Self-warming material captures your pet's body heat and radiate the warmth back to your pet
Each corner is slit to allow a perfect fit into any crate
Soft microfleece top for comfort and non-slip bottom for stability
If you have questions, please contact us at 1-877-738-5188
